scenarios.title: Dating and Romantic Relationships
scenarios.description: Handling Rejection: How to respond gracefully when things don't go as hoped.
scenarios.narrator: You're on a date, and you notice that the other person seems uninterested. You want to handle the situation gracefully.

questions.text: You notice that your date seems distracted and isn't engaging much in the conversation. How do you address this?

options.text: Ask directly if something is wrong.
options.feedback: This might come off as too confrontational.

options.text: Make a light-hearted comment about the situation.
options.feedback: This can help ease the tension and show your understanding.

options.text: Ignore it and keep talking about yourself.
options.feedback: This can make you seem self-centered and unaware of the situation.

options.text: Excuse yourself and leave abruptly.
options.feedback: This is an overreaction and can make things awkward.

questions.text: Your date mentions they had a tough day and are not in the best mood. How do you respond?

options.text: Offer to reschedule the date.
options.feedback: This shows empathy and understanding of their situation.

options.text: Insist on continuing the date and try to cheer them up.
options.feedback: This might come off as inconsiderate of their feelings.

options.text: Complain about your own bad day.
options.feedback: This shifts the focus away from their feelings and can seem insensitive.

options.text: Suggest doing something more exciting to change their mood.
options.feedback: This might seem pushy and not respectful of their current state.

questions.narrator: Despite your efforts, the date does not seem to improve and your date is still uninterested.
questions.text: How do you wrap up the date?

options.text: Express disappointment and ask why it didn't go well.
options.feedback: This can put your date on the spot and make them uncomfortable.

options.text: Thank them for their time and suggest staying in touch.
options.feedback: This shows maturity and respect for their feelings.

options.text: Leave without saying much and don't contact them again.
options.feedback: This can leave a negative impression and show a lack of respect.

options.text: Insist on scheduling another date to make up for it.
options.feedback: This might seem desperate and not considerate of their feelings.

questions.narrator: After the date, you reflect on the experience.
questions.text: What is the best way to handle your own feelings of rejection?

options.text: Blame yourself and feel discouraged about dating.
options.feedback: This is not constructive and can negatively impact your self-esteem.

options.text: Consider it as a learning experience and move on.
options.feedback: This is a healthy approach and helps you grow from the experience.

options.text: Immediately try to arrange another date with someone else.
options.feedback: This can seem like you're avoiding dealing with your feelings.

options.text: Vent your frustrations on social media.
options.feedback: This is not a respectful way to handle rejection and can have negative consequences.

questions.narrator: You decide to send a message to your date to thank them for their time.
questions.text: What should you say in the message?

options.text: Express frustration and ask for another chance.
options.feedback: This can come off as desperate and pushy.

options.text: Thank them for the date and wish them well.
options.feedback: This shows maturity and respect.

options.text: Ask for feedback on why the date didn't go well.
options.feedback: This can make them uncomfortable and feel pressured.

options.text: Ignore the situation and not send any message.
options.feedback: This can seem rude and show a lack of maturity.
